author: KirkMunro
body:
This one is a little odd. In a clean session (only the PSReadline module loaded), if you invoke the command shown below, you'll only see the names of commands that have the same noun, not the syntax. If the module containing those commands is loaded in memory, you'll get the syntax for those commands as well.

Compare:

```powershell
gcm -noun string -syntax
```

with:

```powershell
gcm Join-String,Out-String,Select-String -syntax
```

The former always fails to return the syntax if the module is not loaded. The latter finds the actual commands, loads the module, and returns the syntax for those commands.

# Steps to reproduce

Run this when the Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility module is not loaded:

```powershell
Get-Command -Noun String -Syntax
```

# Expected behavior

```none
Join-String [[-Property] <pspropertyexpression>] [[-Separator] <string>] [-OutputPrefix <string>] [-OutputSuffix <string>] [-UseCulture] [-InputObject <psobject[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

Join-String [[-Property] <pspropertyexpression>] [[-Separator] <string>] [-OutputPrefix <string>] [-OutputSuffix <string>] [-SingleQuote] [-UseCulture] [-InputObject <psobject[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

Join-String [[-Property] <pspropertyexpression>] [[-Separator] <string>] [-OutputPrefix <string>] [-OutputSuffix <string>] [-DoubleQuote] [-UseCulture] [-InputObject <psobject[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

Join-String [[-Property] <pspropertyexpression>] [[-Separator] <string>] [-OutputPrefix <string>] [-OutputSuffix <string>] [-FormatString <string>] [-UseCulture] [-InputObject <psobject[]>] [<CommonParameters>]


Out-String [-Width <int>] [-NoNewline] [-InputObject <psobject>] [<CommonParameters>]

Out-String [-Stream] [-Width <int>] [-InputObject <psobject>] [<CommonParameters>]


Select-String [-Pattern] <string[]> [-Path] <string[]> [-SimpleMatch] [-CaseSensitive] [-Quiet] [-List] [-NoEmphasis] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>] [-NotMatch] [-AllMatches] [-Encoding <Encoding>] [-Context <int[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

Select-String [-Pattern] <string[]> -InputObject <psobject> -Raw [-SimpleMatch] [-CaseSensitive] [-List] [-NoEmphasis] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>] [-NotMatch] [-AllMatches] [-Encoding <Encoding>] [-Context <int[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

Select-String [-Pattern] <string[]> -InputObject <psobject> [-SimpleMatch] [-CaseSensitive] [-Quiet] [-List] [-NoEmphasis] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>] [-NotMatch] [-AllMatches] [-Encoding <Encoding>] [-Context <int[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

Select-String [-Pattern] <string[]> [-Path] <string[]> -Raw [-SimpleMatch] [-CaseSensitive] [-List] [-NoEmphasis] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>] [-NotMatch] [-AllMatches] [-Encoding <Encoding>] [-Context <int[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

Select-String [-Pattern] <string[]> -LiteralPath <string[]> [-SimpleMatch] [-CaseSensitive] [-Quiet] [-List] [-NoEmphasis] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>] [-NotMatch] [-AllMatches] [-Encoding <Encoding>] [-Context <int[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

Select-String [-Pattern] <string[]> -LiteralPath <string[]> -Raw [-SimpleMatch] [-CaseSensitive] [-List] [-NoEmphasis] [-Include <string[]>] [-Exclude <string[]>] [-NotMatch] [-AllMatches] [-Encoding <Encoding>] [-Context <int[]>] [<CommonParameters>]
```

# Actual behavior

```none
Join-String

Out-String

Select-String
```

# Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.5
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: Confirmed this is present in preview5 (had to launch with `-noprofile` to see it, probably incidentally loading most of these modules in my profile).

title: Get-Command -Syntax doesn't always return the syntax
